fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50407].
  {panel}

Jay reported this.

Sherif's notes:

I can actually re-produce this every time on EAC.
1. Create a page, put a calendar in it, embed a events calendar (e.g. atlassian company events)
2. Save the page
3. Takes about 35 seconds on EAC

Now try it again without the calendar macro, or try any other macro (E.g. status) - takes around 15 seconds...

It happens all the time, something we are doing with our calendar macro that could be causing this?
fields.summary: It takes around 20 seconds longer to save a page with an embedded calendar
JIRA events have a gray background when embedded in a page layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50405].
  {panel}

Today you rolled out the new sidebar in Confluence Cloud for me. I now have a second sidebar on the left to switch between spaces, and my page tree looks different.

I'm sure you had reasons to do this. But it has two major drawbacks:
 # It makes working with Confluence considerably slower, because the page tree takes several seconds to load each time (even with a very decent Internet connection).
 # The additional sidebar consumes space on my small screen for something I don't need.

Please provide an option to switch back to the old sidebar / page tree which was much faster, more compact and more configurable!
fields.summary: Make the new sidebar / page tree optional

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50402].
  {panel}

Our team leverages the team calendar confluence plug in. All in all it works really well, but it would be much more useful if we could do that following:

- We use the calendars to track release calendars across our products and platforms, and external partners. One frustration we have is that within each calendar we typically only use the "event" option, but we can't customize this at all. This is super annoying. For example we want to have 1 partner calendar to track all those release dates and milestones and be able to color code them. Unfortunately we can only do that by creating a new calendar (this is really annoying for the team working on all the partner projects as they have to keep adding and removing calendars frequently).
- Create an easily printable view for a user specified amount of time (1 week to multiple months)
- Create the ability to export the team calendar info - PDF and spreadsheet would be great (Would be super helpful for when we work with external partners for project management)
- Create the ability to view more than 1 month at a time. Ideally if I scrolled down on a month view it would pull in the next weeks and I wouldn't have to skip to the next month. Or I could specify the date ranges to Display
fields.summary: Allow for multiple customized "event" types & dates on Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50401].
  {panel}

Use case:
* A user is at the month of March then he scrolls down to the end of the month. 
* He should see April calendar listed
* Click on the second of April then it would be nice if the calendar switches automatically to the month April
fields.summary: Switch month automatically when users click on the month that is not the current month
Indicate birthday events in the inline dialog
Let me reorganize calendars I am subscribed to in my Calendars view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50396].
  {panel}

Dear Calendars Team,

Since you added new feature - Events. I have a few questions that I need to resolve before upgrade production version of our Team Calendars:

1) Our company employees use jointly some calendars (as on attached screenshot). Bring new feature as "Events" do confusion for our employees because each calendar explicitly define what kind of even to create and there is no need for additional events for each calendar. And it is obviously that it is no need to have even "leaves" for Meetings calendar or Business Trips calendar.

So my questions is how to hide events at all?

2) What is acceptable with Team Calendars new release is icons. That is why I would like to find out how to stick icon - "airplane" with Business Trip calendar, icon "leaves" with Annual and Compensatory Leaves Calendar and so on.

3) As well I would like to know how to add our own icons to another calendars such as Absence to due Illness, Meetings, Out of the Office Reports?
fields.summary: If there is only one event type in the calendar, the calendar UI looks quite odd

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50389].

Using Android version 4.0.4 on different Android devices I am not able to add subscription url link to S-Planner or Calender (default application  with operating system by Google). If url https://host.domain:port/paht , I have only 50 characters for path on Android device.

port - 4 characters

This is actually a blocker to use Team Calender on Android devices.
I think it is not necessary to make quite long URL for subscription.

*Preconditions:*

!Screen Shot 2013-12-05 at 9.06.34 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The footer should be moved up to previous page (save paper)
Integrate HipChat and Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50379].
  {panel}

Team Calendars 4.0 shipped with the idea of event types.

We've been thinking that towards the long-term we want to head towards the ability for customers to create their own types of events.

This issues encompasses the idea of being able to create a type of event for a calendar. This would include potential things as: 
* The event name (Kind of incorporated by TEAMCAL-765)
* A possible icon (See TEAMCAL-430)
* A colour (See TEAMCAL-364)

This issue is to track the overall demand for this. To help us better understand your problems, we'd love to hear your thoughts on this. Could you see yourself using it? How? And can you give us examples of the types of events you would create to provide a better understanding? 

{panel}
Hi Everyone,

Thanks for your feedback on this issue. Please note the "priority" set on this issue isn't the actual priority of the feature on our roadmap. There isn't a way for us to hide the unused fields in this project.

We do feel this feature request is a _very_ important part of Team Calendars and I can advise that it is on our short-term roadmap. Unfortunately, for us to enable you guys to create your own types of events for each calendar requires a significant architectural change. The good news is our team is working on this change right now. This re-architecture will also enable us to build other highly requested features as well as provide a significant performance improvement. 

So our first step is to get this re-architecture right! We want to create a stable foundation for the future of Team Calendars. Following that, this will be the next thing we will tackle on our roadmap.

Thank you for your patience with this issue. If you are going to comment, please make it useful in terms of providing some context for the types of events you want to create.
 
Cheers,
Sherif Mansour
Team Calendars Product Manager
{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to add your own types of events to a calendar
Upgrade to FullCalendar 1.6.x
Display more than 10 event in a day  Team Calendar list view
Allow linking / labelling or calendar categories
Ability to find and subscribe to all calendars inside a space
Need a tooltip while editing an event
Should have ellipses for calendar names that are too long
Support "Coordinated Universal Time" timezone format
Have Related pages field linked to attachment show only Attachment Name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50365].
  {panel}

As described in the summary it would be great if we could drag a hyperlink onto a calendar and have it automatically create an event referencing that particular page.

An example of how I would like to use this new feature is:

We have a list of Tasks (each task is a Confluence page) in each user's personal space. 

We would like the user to be able to plan out their week by assigning different tasks pages to different times in the "Week View".
 
To put simply - click and drag a hyperlink into a timeslot in the Team Calendars "Week View", this would then create an event for that particular time that links to the related page.

I'm sure that adding this simple function would benefit many users and broaden the functionality of an already awesome plugin.

Regards,
Lucas
fields.summary: Ability to drag hyperlinks onto Team Calendars to auto-create events linking to the page
The Event macro doesn't seem to be working on my page
Remove select2.js using AUI instead
Long events from JIRA are no whole day events in week view

  {panel}

I was checking my workbox notifications from Confluence and noticed that the Team Calendar upgrade notification message shows what I think are i18n property key values instead of English.

It doesn't bother me at all, but I don't think this is expected behavior.

See attached for view of what I saw

Steps to replicate:
* Upgrade Team Calendars? (this was done by an admin)
* Log in to Confluence
* Click on workbox notification 
* Click on Team Calendar Upgrade Notification
* View message

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50357].
  {panel}

Hello,

The list view in Team Calendars can be quite frustrating to us as one of the key elements of a diary appointment (time) is not showing unless the user hovers over the appointment.

Is there any way / plan to show the event time on the same line as the event day? (see screenshot)l.

Thanks
fields.summary: Ability to see timings in the list view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50356].
  {panel}

Currently there is no parameter I have found for default zoom level for a calendar embedded into a confluence page. 
Specifically I am using timeline view as the default view and it seems to default to all the way zoomed in. 

My goal is to plot where epics will likely fall on a timeline which I can do using custom date fields but when the page is viewed the use must zoom all the way out every time the page is viewed. 

With a set default zoom to 3 month parameter (or even 6 or 12) the viewer would not be required to manually zoom the timeline out every time and would be viewing the timeline as I intend them to view it.

Related to TEAMCAL-1295
If the zoom level was remembered for a user they would not have to zoom it out every time, however being able to set the default zoom level from the beginning would also resolve my issue
fields.summary: Create default Zoom Parameter for the team calendars macro Timeline View
Have an optimized way to use Team Calendars in the Mobile version.
Timeline View could by improved by showing weekends / day-offs
Team calendars on the dashboard doesn't match dashboard design
display the task as a block, calculated based on due date and backwards based on estimated time of development

Allow users to expand and collapse event types
As a PMO Director, I would like the ability to zoom out Team Calendar Timelines so that I can see Project Activity over the course of a year or even two years.
Provide a way to customise notifications
Make it easier to change an event's duration in week view
Should show a friendly message when user try to open Team Calendar in the middle of migration process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50336].
  {panel}

Hi,
We would like to request a new feature on Team Calendars that has more flexible options when any events reoccurs "Monthly". It would be nice to be able to add a monthly, reoccurring task based off the day of the week. Our IT department uses Team Calendar heavily and this was the feature they asked us the very first day when we requested them to switch from Outlook to Team Calendar. We have our Production Code Push every second Saturday of the month and there are other events that occur every 3rd Saturday and some every 4th Saturday. We might be the only one requesting this feature. Since Atalassian listens to the feedback from every customer, i am creating this feature request. This might be not get as many votes. But, if you feel like, this is a genuine request, please implement this feature. I have attached the screenshots showing how the monthly recurrence pattern shows in Team Calendars as well as Outlook. 

Thanks
Adhip
fields.summary: Appointment Recurrence
The OK and cancel buttons (when adding calendar events) are often hidden on devices with smaller screen resolutions such as iPad/notebook/tablet.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50325].
  {panel}

Ability to see from a viewpage which events are linked to it so you can get some context about the page and not have to "repeat" such things as dates, who etc... because they are already tracked in the calendar. 

---
Original description:
I am working with release calendars, and I currently use the "Related page" option to link to a page for each release/system (one page per release per system).

In this release page, I would like to display the date(s) for deployment into the different test environments. Currently, we have one event per environment gathered in this release page, and we have to manually edit the dates in the release page if there are any changes to any of the related events. 

I would like to be able to display all dates for a given release (multiple events per release), so that the dates will automatically change if there is a change in the event itself.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see details of events which are linked to page from the viewpage
Event macro "send email to attendees" feature should use in-product share feature rather than a mailto: link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50323].
  {panel}

When there are upcoming events with each day containing ONLY 3 events (or less), there are a total of 12 events (3 days) displayed:
!screenshot002.jpg!

For some users, the display seems to be too long and they would like an option to configure the number of days and the number of events in each day shown in the dashboard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create three upcoming events per day (4 or 5 days)
# Go to dashboard, and you should see a total of 4 days are shown, with each day consisting of 3 events. Total: 12 events

h3. Notes:
This feature also applies if for the below scenario where you want to display more than 10 events in a single day:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add a feature to configure the number of days or events shown in the dashboard through UI
Ability to create tasks on a calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50318].
  {panel}

Having timeline events last just a little causes the items to be unreadable.

Items should display the complete text and have 1 or 2 markers to indicate how much the event lasts.

Take http://timeline.verite.co/ as an example, where the block points to the given date, still allowing the item to be read.

Timeline should be readable without having to click the items.
fields.summary: All-day items are unreadable (or: As a user, I'd like to be able to read the complete item in the timeline even if it just lasts one day)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50314].
  {panel}

As a team member of a self-organizing team I want to quickly see whether a new task with time constraints can be taken over by one of our team members.

To this end I'd like to have a swimlane view in team calendars, so that e.g. each calender is displayed in a single line of the calender view.

Advantage: can be used for an uncluttered view on who has free capacity at which dates.

see e.g. [www.teamweek.com] for an implementation in a competitors calender.
fields.summary: Swimlane view
Additional Configuration of JIRA Issue Events - (choose which fields are displayed)
Event macro string missing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50310].
  {panel}

With the release of Calendars 4.0 the notion of a generic People calendar has gone away. An Event calendar can be associated with a user, however that user information is not easily seen on the Event calendar without clicking into the Event.

We use Calendars for our support on-call rotation. Prior to version 4 we had a People calendar called "On Call" which clearly indicated who was on call for a given week. We've totally lost that ability with Calendars 4. I can name an Event "On Call" and associate the user with that week of support duty, but you have to click twice (once on the event, then edit) to actually see the name of the person that's on call.

This is a significant feature degradation from the 3.2.x version of Calendars.

So, as a user I would like an Event calendar that's associated with a user to clearly display the user on the calendar so that I don't have to click twice to get this information.

As an aside, I realize that there's "Leave" and "Birthday" calendars which are more analogous to the old People calendar, but since they are hard coded with those names it would be totally unintuitive to use them for any other purpose, such as an on call calendar.
fields.summary: Event Calendars Associated with a User Should Display that User's Name in the Calendar
Estimated Time/All Day Event and Colors For Statuses

Team Calendars giving an authentication error in the daily summary email
iCalendar data extraction help needed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50300].
  {panel}

I find that the 'Month' view of a calendar gets more cluttered and less useful later in a month as compared to early in a month. For example, when today is March 1, I can see everything that is upcoming for the next 4 weeks but then when today is March 27 the "month" view is showing mostly the past several weeks, which has been cluttered with a lot of no longer relevant details. This is a very common usability problem in calendar apps. 

It would be nice if there were another view mode of 'next 4 weeks', with the current week always on top. That way, the calendar is always showing the upcoming schedule not the past schedule.

There's a similar request for Outlook:
http://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/office/en-US/acd04b88-6890-4bac-8f48-3028085ed2bd/outlook-2010-view-calendar-view-for-weeks-ahead-not-weeks-past?forum=outlook
fields.summary: Add variant of Month view that shows weeks ahead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50299].
  {panel}

*Steps*
* Login to confluence successfully
* Click on Calendar link - on the header
* View calendar in view mode

If this calendar has more than 1 timezone, display it as attached picture (https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/106306/Calendar%20View.png)
Just see this during the blitz test and it would be nice if we have this
fields.summary: To have more than 1 timezone view in the calendar view
Cannot disable drag-and-drop for Jira calendars
Remove dependency on spring-osgi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50295].
  {panel}

Currently, on timeline for the Calendar, the dates are at the bottom of the timeline.

Normally this is fine, but when there are lots of dates, it stacks up, and you get a vertically scrolling timeline.

The fix for this, and to display better, is to add an option/button to flip the timeline calendar, putting the date at the top of the timeline, and subsequent events pushing downward. Then, have the ability to expand the calendar downward, either by dragging (like this comment box) or by adding extra space via a button.

So if you have a huge amount of tasks currently on your timeline, you will be able to see as many as you want, rather than be limited once they hit the top of the allowed space.

Recap:
1) Add ability to put calendar axis at top of timeline instead of bottom
2) Add ability to control vertical size of timeline
fields.summary: Ability to expand the hight of the timleine view and see the dates at both the top and bottom of the timeline

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50294].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the both the timeline and calendar views have their horizontal sizes fixed, regardless the size of the page and the resolution of the screen. As a result, Team Calendars displayed on bigger screens or in a 90% rotation don't use the screen space efficiently, e.g.:
!Screen Shot 2015-06-18 at 13.29.58.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the autosizing for the Team Calendar views. This would be more comfortable, e.g. when displaying the timeline view page with a big screen with number of events, showing the calendars on a vertically rotated screen.
fields.summary: Auto Adjust the Horizontal and Vertical Size of Calendar and Timeline Views Based on the Screen Resolution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50293].
  {panel}

Hey guys,

We need to add the new Team Calendars logos in Confluence in time for Brand Amp that's taking place August 27th.

There are two logos in the product that need to be updated. When you first log in to a new Team Calendars instance, you're presented with a getting started dialog. The second area is the WorkBox notification, when Team Calendars has been installed or upgraded, users are notified via WorkBox and that notification includes the old Team Calendars logo.

This doesn't have to get done by August 27th, but would be good to slip into TC 4 if it's just a quick fix. I've attached the logo to this ticket.
fields.summary: New Team Calendars logos for Brand Amp
Include Edit and color options for calendar when Team Calendar macro is displayed
Add a feature to restrict users to add event in the existing timeslot

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50289].
  {panel}

We're using team calendars since 2 years now and we still struggle to apply the use cases we have with to the features team calendars do provide.

Out of recent discussions I'd like to propose a new feature that would help us address a good percentage of the potential use cases and IMHO would also help a lot of other customers.

* As a user I want to add my vacation days only once to my own calendar so that the multiple teams I'm part of can pick it and make an 'aggregated calendar' per team out of it
* As a team lead I want to be able to pick the vacation calendars of my team members once and create a named calendar out of it, so that I can export it to other calendar systems like Outlook as a single operation.
* As a production site space admin I want to pick multiple calendars from the hr/learning/xxx department and aggregate it into a single Site Events calendar
* As a production site reader I want to subscribe to a named site calender with a single click, I want to be able to export this calendar with a single operation
* As global HR department I want to be able to pick the event calendars of my local HR departments and publish them as a single named HR calendar
* As a user being interested in global HR events I want to subscribe to a named site calender with a single click, I want to be able to export this calendar with a single operation.

Does this make sense? AFAICS I could solve a series of requests of my users having this aggregation feature. Solving the vacation calendar problem would be a killer feature...

I'm open to discuss the details with you...
fields.summary: Ability to create aggregate calendars of different event types from different calendars
Possibility to show Versions in TeamCalender with Start- and End-Date
Add flexibility to the Who field and allow users starting with @
JIRA Issue Dates - Ability to choose fields for Calendar Output display

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50285].
  {panel}

Normally in gantt charts dependencies are clearly visible. 
Something similar should be possible in Team Calendar:
Having Issues marked/linked as "depends on" ... should provide this information in the Team Calendar View. At least if hoovering over the issue.
Better by having lines to connect the bars and even better if issue x cannot be draged before issue y if x depends on y.
We have lots of dependencies between issues and being able to see them in team calendar would be a great benefit.
fields.summary: Make Issue Dependencies visible in Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50284].
  {panel}

Improvements: 
1. There is no bottom border in Event Type drop-down box
2. The Hour & Date is incorrect position
From Time + From Date ===> To Time + To Date
instead of 
From Date + From Time ==> To Time + To Date
3. The width of When field exceeds the common width of other controls
